meta.name: Claura Design System
meta.description: Comprehensive design system for AI Agency website based on claura.framer.ai. This file serves as the single source of truth for all UI components, styles, and design guidelines.

guidelines.overview: Claura is a warm, professional, and trustworthy design system for AI/automation service businesses. It avoids cold tech aesthetics in favor of organic warmth, natural imagery, and human-centered design.

corePrinciples.name: Warmth Over Tech
corePrinciples.description: Use warm, organic color palettes (creams, browns, coral) and natural imagery (flowers, soft gradients) instead of cold blues, circuits, or harsh neon. The goal is to make AI feel approachable, not intimidating.

corePrinciples.name: Trust Through Clarity
corePrinciples.description: Build trust with clear typography hierarchy, prominent statistics and social proof, straightforward messaging, and no jargon. Every element should reduce cognitive load.

corePrinciples.name: Generous Breathing Room
corePrinciples.description: Use ample whitespace and generous padding (80-120px between sections) to let content breathe. This creates a premium, unhurried feel that builds confidence.

corePrinciples.name: Contrast for Impact
corePrinciples.description: Alternate between light cream (#FAF9F6) and dark charcoal (#1A1A1F) sections to create visual rhythm, emphasize key content, and maintain engagement during scroll.

corePrinciples.name: Subtle Sophistication
corePrinciples.description: Animations should be smooth and understated (300-600ms, ease curves), never flashy or distracting. The interface should feel polished but not performative.

corePrinciples.name: Strong Typography Hierarchy
corePrinciples.description: Use large, confident serif headlines (Playfair Display) with highlighted accent words (lighter weight, italic) paired with clean sans-serif body text (Inter).

do: Use warm, organic colors (cream, brown, coral, teal)
Include social proof prominently (stats, testimonials, logos)
Highlight key words in headlines with italic/lighter weight
Use rounded corners on all cards and images (1.5-2rem)
dont: Use cold blues, purples, or neon colors
Clutter the interface with too many elements
Include tech clichÃ©s (circuits, robots, matrix effects)
Use sharp corners or boxy layouts

colors.description: Color palette inspired by natural warmth - creams, earth tones, and sunset gradients

cream.usage: Main background color for light sections

creamDark.usage: Input backgrounds, card backgrounds, hover states

typography.description: Elegant serif for display, clean sans-serif for body

display.usage: Headlines, large display text, brand name

animations.description: Smooth, subtle animations powered by Framer Motion. All animations should feel polished but understated.
animations.framework: Framer Motion (React) or CSS animations with similar easing

fadeInUp.description: Fade in while moving up - primary scroll-triggered animation

css.keyframes: @keyframes fadeInUp { from { opacity: 0; transform: translateY(30px); } to { opacity: 1; transform: translateY(0); } }

fadeInDown.description: Fade in while moving down - for dropdowns/menus

staggerChildren.description: Parent container that staggers child animations

characterByCharacter.description: Letters appear one by one - used for hero 'Claura' text and testimonial quotes. Split text into individual spans and stagger their animations.

wordByWord.description: Words fade in sequentially - alternative to character animation

buttonTextSlide.description: Button contains two identical text layers stacked vertically. Container has overflow:hidden. On hover, both translate up by 100%, revealing the bottom text. Creates a sliding reveal effect.

css.structure: .btn { overflow: hidden; } .btn-text { display: block; transition: transform 0.3s cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); } .btn:hover .btn-text { transform: translateY(-100%); }

cardLift.description: Card lifts up slightly with enhanced shadow

imageZoom.description: Image scales up on hover - used in team cards
imageZoom.css: img { transition: transform 0.5s ease-out; } .card:hover img { transform: scale(1.05); }

linkUnderline.description: Underline grows from left to right on hover
linkUnderline.css: a::after { content: ''; position: absolute; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 0; height: 1px; background: currentColor; transition: width 0.3s ease; } a:hover::after { width: 100%; }

parallax.description: Subtle vertical movement based on scroll position using useScroll and useTransform

framerMotion.implementation: const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll(); const y = useTransform(scrollYProgress, [0, 1], [0, -100]);

fadeOnScroll.description: Elements fade in when entering viewport

progressBar.description: Reading progress indicator linked to scroll

framerMotion.implementation: const { scrollYProgress } = useScroll(); <motion.div style={{ scaleX: scrollYProgress, transformOrigin: 'left' }} />

logoScroll.description: Infinite horizontal scroll for brand logos. Duplicate the content to create seamless loop.

css.keyframes: @keyframes marquee { from { transform: translateX(0); } to { transform: translateX(-50%); } }
css.structure: Two identical copies of logos side by side, animate the container

indicatorSlide.description: Active indicator slides to selected tab

counter.description: Numbers count up from 0 to final value when entering viewport
counter.implementation: Use a library like react-countup or custom hook with requestAnimationFrame

webgl.description: Page uses WebGL shaders for some effects (detected uTime uniform)
webgl.usage: Background gradients and organic effects may use canvas/WebGL
webgl.fallback: Provide CSS gradient fallbacks for non-WebGL browsers

springConfigs.description: Reusable spring configurations for Framer Motion

navigation.description: Sticky header navigation with centered or left-aligned logo

button.description: Rounded pill buttons with text-slide hover animation

hoverAnimation.description: Container has overflow:hidden. Contains two identical text elements stacked vertically. On hover, both translate up by 100%, revealing the bottom text.

withIcon.icon: arrow-right for CTAs, play for video buttons

hero.description: Full-width hero section with centered content

highlightedWord.description: Key words like 'AI', 'everything', 'typical' are styled differently

sectionLabel.description: Small pill badge that labels sections (e.g., 'Services', 'How we work')

sectionHeading.description: Large section headlines with optional highlighted words

statsCard.description: Glassmorphism cards displaying key metrics on gradient background

servicesTabs.description: Numbered service tabs (01, 02, 03, 04) with image and description

testimonial.description: Large quote card with gradient background image
testimonial.background: Gradient image (orange/coral/teal blend) with organic imagery

tagMarquee.description: Scrolling tags at top showing features/anti-features

caseStudy.description: Case study section with narrative and stats

teamGrid.description: Grid of team member photos with overlay info

ctaSection.description: Final CTA with split layout - visual card + form

visualCard.background: Gradient image with orange/coral organic imagery

alternatingBackgrounds.description: Sections alternate between light and dark backgrounds for visual rhythm

iconography.style: Simple, minimal line icons with rounded caps
